Ingredients.3: 1 (1.25 ounce) package reduced-sodium taco seasoning mix

Ingredients.6: 1 (12 ounce) bag shredded Mexican cheese blend

Directions.1: Combine enchilada sauce, water, and taco seasoning in a slow cooker. Cut chicken breasts in half lengthwise and add to the slow cooker. Cook on Low until chicken is tender, 4 to 5 hours.

Directions.2: Remove chicken and shred using 2 forks. Mix back into the sauce in the slow cooker.

Directions.3: Spoon some of the chicken mixture onto a tortilla. Sprinkle shredded cheese on top. Cover with another tortilla.

Directions.4: Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Slide quesadilla into the skillet. Cook until browned on both sides, 2 to 4 minutes, flipping halfway through. Repeat with remaining tortillas, chicken, and cheese.
